title.narrative: CATALYZING THE CONTRIBUTION OF INDIGENOUS LANDS TO THE CONSERVATION OF BRAZIL’S FOREST ECOSYSTEMS

description.narrative: CATALYZING THE CONTRIBUTION OF INDIGENOUS LANDS TO THE CONSERVATION OF BRAZIL’S FOREST ECOSYSTEMS
lake

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: A groundtested and officially recognized strategy for environmental management in Indigenous Lands IL by Indigenous Peoples IP is adopted in Brazil for the effective conservation and sustainable use of forest biodiversity

1 Increase in the area ha of representative forest ecosystems of Brazil under conservation through the recognized environmental goals of ILs that by the end of the project are
i incorporated into a network of ethnomanagement practices for conservation of different forest ecosystems in Brazil ILs ha in network with recognized BD goals
ii identified as contributing to long term targets of PNAP and part of IL Environmental Management Plan with specific strategies for implementation ILs ha in long term plans

comment.narrative: 1 Currently ILs in different forest biomes provide conservation to forest biodiversity but the contribution to national conservation plans and targets is not measured nor are the IPs management practices readily translated into terms that can be recognized and funded through resources available for biodiversity conservation The potential for contribution to Brazil conservation goals is thus not fully recognized

The PNGATI Steering Committee installed on Oct 30 2013 has since met several times During the 2nd CG PNGATI Ordinary Meeting on 0325 262014 two Technical Councils were created one to organize the PNGATI National Conference and the other to create the Integrated Plan for PNGATI implementation PIPNGATI The latter promoted a workshop on 1120 212014 to create a logical framework for implementation of the Policy This framework will be used by the different ministries to orient the federal governments Pluriannual Plan for 20162019 currently being constructed by the Ministry of Planning and Budget And during the 4th Ordinary Meeting 120221032014 the CG PNGATI discussed the planning framework proposal and defined a timeline for ordinary meetings in 2015

description.narrative: CerrradoP

comment.narrative: According to the Permanent Interministerial Working Group PPCerrados 2nd Phase Report 20142015 the 95 Indigenous Lands in the Cerrado Biome continue to show very low rates of deforestation on the order of 4 of their total area slightly more than 90000 km2 This compares very favorably with the rate for conservation areas 22 and agricultural settlements 40 and clearly demonstrates the effectivity of ILs in conserving biodiversity of the Cerrado Brazils second largest biome

Through partnership with TNC an alternative instrument to measure management effectiveness in ILs was created This instrument was presented and improved in a workshop held in October 2014 at Funai in Brasília The improved version was applied in Oiapoque ILs with very positive results including the perception of its usefulness by the village leaders involved in its application

ILs in network ha in network ha IL in plan

The PNGATI Steering committee has drafted an Integrated plan for policy implementation This framework will be used by the different ministries to orient the federal governments Pluriannual Plan for 20162019 currently being constructed by the Ministry of Planning and Budget with the idea of creating synergy between the actions of the different ministries

description.narrative:
4 Increase in IP capacities for leading and upscaling environmental management actions for conserving representative forest ecosystems in Brazil
IOs with institutional technical capacities to execute monitor IL National Plans projects
Indigenous initiativescentres for training in environmental management for BD conservation sustainable use of natural resources

comment.narrative:
Today COIAB FOIRN and CIR have institutional capacity for the execution of ethnomanagement and ethnozoning plans None has the capacity to execute a national plan of environmental management
A Centre for Indigenous training exists in the Amazon CAFI and in 2006 trained 15 IPs in environmental management but this does not include standards and practices for ethnozoning for BD conservation Other regions do not have Centres or trained IPs

All IO of the 5 regional networks have strengthened capacities for environmental management and to execute monitor IL National Plans projects
20 IP in each of the biomes have skill required for ethnoenvironmental management

The itinerant training program Mosarambihara Seeders for the GuaraniKaiowá of 3 reference areas in Mato Grosso do Sul held its first course module in December 2014 The indigenous organization ASCURI has been hired by means of a Letter of Agreement to carry out the remaining modules and register the course in video
The proposed course in Agroecology for the Terena with the Universidade Estadual do Mato Grosso do Sul UEMS Glória de Dourados campus has been shifted from a techical degree to a full undergraduate degree University personnel and indigenous representatives will meet with the Ministry of Education in Brasília on July 1 2015 for further discussion as to funding mechanisms for this proposal
Through an agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN indigenous organizations in project reference areas presented proposals to a small grants program funded by the project with 37 proposals approved see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684ide236a7b66ee4a987eb951

description.narrative: A network of ILs modeling environmental management practices for conservation in different forest biomes is in place and is being effectively managed by the indigenous peoples and organizations
IP schools nationwide

comment.narrative: 1 for the whole Amazon region

Partner organization IEB with support of the Moore Foundation surveyed existing experiences with training of indigenous environmental agents in Amazonia and held a seminar with representatives of these programs in April 2015 A national seminar for which the project will bring representatives from other regions is planned for the second semester 2015

description.narrative: developed and tested

comment.narrative: 5 communities in Oiapoque are testing environmental management strategies
10 tested ethnomanagement plan with defined sustainable use conservation practices zones and goals relevant for each of the four forest biomes

The project assisted in the establishment of a new technical cooperation project BRA13019 between Funai and UNDP signed in December 2013 to help implement PNGATI and apply resources from the Fundo ClimaMMAMinistério do Meio Ambiente The project assisted in drafting the public call for proposal for ethnomanagement plans PGTAs in the Caatinga and Cerrado biomes R 28 million launched in August 2014 Of the 15 proposals selected 4 are project reference areas Bakairi Xerente Xacriabá and Corrego João Pereira ILs and were written with the help of project consultants Through a Letter of Agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN the project is assisting in the initial training of the organizations carrying out the proposals see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id65d3e8bacee4a987eb951
The project assisted Funai and MMA in drafting the Fundo AmazoniaBNDES call for PGTA proposals R 70 million published in 08 May 2014 and helped the AndiráMarau IL a reference area to prepare its proposal in partnership with the Centro de Trabalho Indigenista CTI The proposal was approved along with a proposal by CPIAcre which will benefit Mamoadate IL another reference area

description.narrative: 11 Degree of replication of experiences from Reference Areas to other ILs that improve management effectiveness as measured by increase in the METT scores of a sample of 23 ILS

comment.narrative:
METT for a sample of 23 ILs
Poor 0
Fair 9
Good 9
Excellent 5

All Poor and Fair have reached at least Good Scores
All Good have reached Excellent Scores
All Excellent have remained Excellent

Through a Letter of Agreement with project partner TNC an alternative instrument was proposed and tested in a workshop in Brasília in Oct 2014 This instrument is currently being applied in reference areas in the Oiapoque region Amapá with very positive results

description.narrative: are officially recognized as meeting established norms for conservation by environmental and indigenous agencies in each regional

comment.narrative: Today about 60 of the RAs have conserved areas but their contribution to biodiversity conservation is not measure not recognized officially by relevant institutions eg FUNAI and IBAMAOEMAS
All plans in reference areas are officially recognized as meeting norms by environmental agencies in each region

Although there is no legal instrument that officially recognizes PGTAs they are increasingly being used as instruments for public policy in regards to indigenous lands and in situations where they may be a part of environmentalsocial mitigation and compensation programs

description.narrative: 10 Number of ethnomanagement plans in ILs that are

comment.narrative: see data below
see data below

Through a letter of agreement with AnaiBahia ethnomanagement plans were developed for the reference areas Entre Serras and CaiçaraIlha de São Pedro Northeast Region These were presented during a threeday seminar held in Paulo Afonso Bahia April 710 2015 see httpus3campaignarchive1comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id71b7f2febae4a987eb951 At the present moment therefore 8 of the project reference areas have ethnomanagement plans completed Mamoadate Igarapé Lourdes Wajãpi Galibi Jumina Uaçá ILs already had ethnomanagement plans
The project surveyed gray literature and other sources identifying another 45 existing ethnomanagement plans in other ILs as well as a few other plans that cover a portion of an IL
The project assisted Funai in establishing a new technical cooperation project with UNDP BRA13019 to help implement PNGATI and apply resources from the Fundo ClimaMMAMinistério do Meio Ambiente The project assisted in drafting the public call for proposasl for ethnomanagement plans PGTAs in the Caatinga and Cerrado biomes R 28 million launched in August 2014 Of the 15 proposals selected 4 are project reference areas Bakairi Xerente Xacriabá and Corrego João Pereira ILs and were written with the help of project consultants Through a Letter of Agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN the project assisted in the initial training of the organizations carrying out the proposals see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id65d3e8bacee4a987eb951
Also with the assistance of ISPN the project launched a call for small projects in the reference areas and TaunayIpegue IL approved a project for ethnomapping
Project consultants are carrying out ethnomapping workshops in Bracui IL Rio de Janeiro as part of an ethnomanagement plan In Mangueirinha IL Paraná the project held a threeday workshop to discuss ethnomanagement including one day of ethnomapping see httpus3campaignarchive1comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684ide8a23d4715e4a987eb951
Through partnership with TNC training of youths in ethnomapping was carried out in TrincheiraBacajá IL
The project signed a letter of agreement with the Comissão PróÍndioAcre to carry out the revision of Mamoadate ILs ethnomanagement plan
The basic tools of ethnomanagement ethnomapping and ethnozoning are being discussed in all the PNGATI training courses see for example httpus3campaignarchive1comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id502428d96ae4a987eb951

description.narrative: 12 of indigenous curricula that include information on BD environmental management

comment.narrative: see data below
see data below

As part of its final actions and products the project is discussing a series of publications containing information on the biodiversity of the reference areas as part of a strategy to produce information accessible to several target audiences including schools

description.narrative: Mechanisms and tools have been developed that enable Brazils ILs to be recognized and strengthened as effective areas for conserving forest biodiversity natural resources and the environmental services

8 Regulations adopted for environmental management in ILs including regulations on
ethno zoning in ILs
landuse in areas surrounding ILs
management of overlapping IL and UCs
sustainable use of forest resources of IL

comment.narrative:
At least 3 categories of ethnozoning recognized for conservation sustainable use and restoration
At least 1 regulation regarding landuse in the areas surrounding ILs eg creation of IL buffers zones
Norms on homologizing management plans and ethnoplans of IL and UC
Agreedupon standards and limits for use of forest resources
The joint Working Group on IL and conservation area overlap presented a report of its activities mapping all instances of overlap

description.narrative: 5Existence of recognized environmental management standards and targets in Indigenous Lands

comment.narrative:
A National Protected Areas Plan PNAP exists to guide the establishment of a comprehensive system of protected areas including contributions from ILs s but no specific targets standards or practices for these are defined
In Sept 2008 a working group GTI was established to elaborate a proposal of National Policy for Environmental Management in IL

A National Conservation Plan for Indigenous Lands that contains targets for conservation of representative forest ecosystems through environmental management exists and is harmonized and integrated with the NPAP and adapted to the environmental and social needs of ILs
this Plan would be aligned with and form part of a National Policy on Environmental Management of IL PNGATI

The PNGATI Steering Committee installed on Oct 30 2013 has since met several times During the 2nd CG PNGATI Ordinary Meeting on 0325 262014 two Technical Councils were created one to organize the PNGATI National Conference and the other to create the Integrated Plan for PNGATI implementation PIIPNGATI The latter promoted a workshop on 1120 212014 to create a logical framework for implementation of the Policy This framework will be used by the different ministries to orient the federal governments Pluriannual Plan for 20162019 currently being constructed by the Ministry of Planning and Budget And during the 4th Ordinary Meeting 120221032014 the CG PNGATI discussed the planning framework proposal and defined a timeline for ordinary meetings in 2015

description.narrative: 6 Resources from existing biodiversity conservation sources used to achieve basic operating standards for environmental management in ILs

comment.narrative:
ILs currently do not receive funding for environmental management activities from public funding sources for biodiversity conservation
Isolated support from NGOs to undertake environmental management andor territorial surveillance activities in the ILs of Oiapoque Amapá and Kayapó

At least 5 of the Reference ILs will receive at least 50 of the costs of basic operations from new funding mechanisms that include resources currently only available for biodiversity conservation in PA environmental services compensation
The project will work to determine costs of meeting basic operational standards and will test different funding mechanisms

The project assisted in the establishment of a new technical cooperation project BRA13019 between Funai and UNDP signed in December 2013 to help implement PNGATI and apply resources from the Fundo ClimaMMAMinistério do Meio Ambiente The project assisted in drafting the public call for proposal for ethnomanagement plans PGTAs in the Caatinga and Cerrado biomes R 28 million launched in August 2014 O f the 15 proposals selected 4 are project reference areas and were written with the help of project consultants Through a Letter of Agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN the project is assisting in the initial training of the organizations carrying out the proposals
The project assisted Funai and MMA in drafting the Fundo AmazoniaBNDES call for PGTA proposals R 70 million published in 08 May 2014 and helped the AndiráMarau IL a reference area to prepare its proposal in partnership with the Centro de Trabalho Indigenista CTI The proposal was approved along with a proposal by CPIAcre which will benefit Mamoadate IL another reference area
Project partner TNC also approved a project with the Fundo Amazônia in an earlier call for projects for implementation of ethnomanagement plans in the reference areas where it is currently working Amapá and Pará states R 15 million

description.narrative: 9 Existence of surveillance and monitoring plans with standards and practices defined to support the implementation of ethno zoning and plans

comment.narrative:
Only ILs that were part of PPTAL in the Amazon have surveillance and monitoring protocols and carry out inspection activities in ILs but these do not contain environmental monitoring nor are they related to specific ethno zones and their goals
ILs in other forest biomes do not have surveillance and monitoring protocols and only have Indigenous Surveillance observation Stations that are not related to zoning

All the IL reference areas have established surveillance Protocols and undertaken environmental monitoring
50 of the ILs composing the network have established Surveillance Protocols and are developing environmental monitoring systems
Although no new specific regulations have been created monitoring and surveillance of ILs is an ongoing activity for Funai in colaboration with Ibama

description.narrative: See above

comment.narrative: lt15 of FUNAI has core groups of staff trained on environmental management and sustainable use activities in IL
At least 1 staff member in the OEMAs of the states of SC MS BA PE AM PA AC and RO trained to monitor these norms and regulations
See above

description.narrative: 7 Staff competencies and skills in MMA IBAMA ICMBio FUNAI OEMAs andor municipal agencies aligned to implement and follow specific norms and regulations for ethnomanagement and ethnozoning in ILs

comment.narrative: see data below
see data below

The PNGATI training course held at Acadebio Academia Nacional da Biodiversidade for the Mata Atlantica Biome a joint effort of Funai MMAICMBio and the project held the last of its 5 modules in November 2014
The training course in PNGATI for the Northeast region MG and ES with 5 itinerant modules 4 of which were in or nearby project reference areas with visits in the latter cases held its last module in May 2015 with an optional visit to the Cavernas de Peruaçu National Park arranged by an ICMBio employee who participated in the course
A similar training course for the Cerrado biome held its first module in Brasília in June 2015 with a MMA employee participating

description.narrative: Sustainable and replicable models of forest management based on ethnomanagement principles are piloted in selected ILs from different forest biomes
14 Increase in the of IP diet derived from the new agroecological production systems in ILs Reference Areas in the Caatinga Cerrado and AF

comment.narrative:
IPs in Amazon get food from in the IL
IPs diet in Cerrado and the Atlantic Forest comes from locally grown crops and food bought in regional markets
IPs in Caatinga grow and gather food in IL exerting high pressure on the few resources available
Base line values will be established by ethnozoning ethnomanagement plans
Community inside IL subsist with production derived from agroecological production within the zones delimited for this use

Through a letter of agreement the Centro de Desenvolvimento Agroecologico Sabia carried out agroecological and agroforestry extension in 3 reference areas in the Northeast region training youths as multipliers see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id29a8d98645e4a987eb951
In collaboration with the Projeto Warana Agroecologia the project helped organize the 1st Fair of Seeds Flavors and Knowledge in the AndiráMarau IL Amazonas Seehttpus3campaignarchive1comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684id5bee8f2c3fe4a987eb951
The project is currently supporting an 8module extension course in Agroecology with the three Terena reference areas in Mato Grosso do Sul Cachoeirinha Lalima and TaunayIpegue in collaboration with the Universidade Estadual do Mato Grosso do Sul Campus Glória de Dourados The first module was held in June 2015 and the following modules will be held in the second semester of 2015
Through an agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN indigenous organizations in project reference areas presented proposals to a small grants program with 37 proposals approved see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684ide236a7b66ee4a987eb951 A number of the projects have agroecology as their focus

ILs in Cerrado Caatinga and Atlantic Forest with at least one incomegenerating agroecological activity
In the Amazon 3 of the 4 RAs with trading activities implemented

Through an agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN indigenous organizations in project reference areas presented proposals to a small grants program with 37 proposals approved see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684ide236a7b66ee4a987eb951 A number of the projects have extractive production as their focus

description.narrative: 13 Reduction in unsustainable extractive practices in the RAs

comment.narrative: The base line values will be established by ethnozoning and ethnomanagement plans
100 reduction in the caatinga cerrado and Atlantic forest biomes in the Amazon biome

Ibirama IL SC approved a small project to produce of seedlings of the jussara palm Euterpe edulis for replanting in areas where this species has been decimated by extraction of palm hearts building on and expanding the microproject
In Mangueirinha IL Paraná indigenous leaders expressed concern with harvesting levels of erva maté and other forest products and suggested carrying out an inventory of these resources The project brought leaders to Brasília to discuss inclusion of Mangueirinha IL in the National Forest Inventory carried out by the Serviço Florestal Brasileiro with GEF funding through FAO see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684idc20c4bfa0ce4a987eb951

description.narrative: 16 Area of fragmented forest restored in IL of A forest with native species to improve connectivity

comment.narrative: The base line values will be established by ethnozoning and ethnomanagement plans
At least 40 of the fragmented areas that are critical to connectivity are in the process of restoration with native species

Through an agreement with the Instituto Sociedade População e Natureza ISPN indigenous organizations in project reference areas presented proposals to a small grants program with 37 proposals approved see httpus3campaignarchive2comu37099afc6b3fe6c9fbcec7684ide236a7b66ee4a987eb951 A number of the projects have agroforestry and landscape recuperation as their focus
In the Potiguara IL a number of smallscale initiatives for reforestation are underway funded by microprojects and with technical assistance provided through the Letter of Agreement with the Centro Sabiá Through these initiatives an estimated 64 hectares have been planted
The project has drafted a technical document summarizing the potential contribution of ILs by means of initiatives of environmental restoration to help Brasil meet its goals of forest restoration and carbon sequestration that it has assumed in international conventions or agreements such as Aichi or the Bonn Challenge document with executive summary in English is attached
